slides.title: Welcome to Rating Basics
slides.notes: Introduction to the Rating Basics in PolicyCenter.
slides.narration: Welcome to our exploration of Rating Basics in Guidewire PolicyCenter. This lesson will guide you through the essential components and processes involved in rating, a crucial part of any Policy Administration System. We'll delve into how PolicyCenter handles rating content, from rate tables to rate routines, and how these elements integrate to calculate premiums. Let's embark on this journey to understand how to effectively manage and implement rating in PolicyCenter.

slides.title: Understanding PolicyCenter Rating
slides.notes: The importance of adapting rating content for PolicyCenter.
slides.narration: As you transition to PolicyCenter, adapting your existing rating content is crucial. While your rating manual remains unchanged, the format of your rating data often needs adjustment to align with PolicyCenter's requirements. This session will focus on the practical steps necessary to ensure a seamless integration of your rating data into PolicyCenter, setting the stage for accurate and efficient policy administration.

slides.title: PolicyCenter Rating Overview
slides.originalNotes:
Business overview
By moving to PolicyCenter, you are implementing a Policy Administration System. Your existing rating content is most likely not ready for the system. While the rating manual stays the same, you need to focus early efforts on adjusting the rating content format so that it works for PolicyCenter.
slides.notes:
Business overview
By moving to PolicyCenter, you are implementing a Policy Administration System. Your existing rating content is most likely not ready for the system. While the rating manual stays the same, you need to focus early efforts on adjusting the rating content format so that it works for PolicyCenter.
slides.narration: In PolicyCenter, costs are the heart of the rating process. These costs, which are persisted as premium and tax breakdowns, are calculated per risk, per line of business, and per policy. Understanding how to manage these costs effectively is crucial, as they include various elements like vehicle costs, line costs, and additional charges such as taxes and surcharges. This overview sets the foundation for managing financial aspects within the system.

slides.title: Rate Tables and Definitions
slides.originalNotes:
Preparing content for PolicyCenter rating
The goal of the rating content •translation" is to arrive at the following components: Costs, Rate Flow, Rate Routines* , Rate Tables*.

The present state of rating determines the work required to transform rating content. Rating content may already exist, but its exact state varies. Any of the following could be true:

1) The rates are available in a spreadsheet for calculation or the rates can be automatically rated using a predetermined formula
2) A spreadsheet model is available for rate calculation
3) The rating content exists in a PDF or manual

Rate flow is the logic in the rating engine. It orchestrates the premium calculation for a policy line. Rate Routines and Rate Tables are of particular interest to the actuaries because this is the data with which they have the most familiarity. Rate books are a group of rate tables and rate routines, and the rate flow logic selects the rate book that will be used to access rate tables and rate routines.

slides.narration: Rate routines are the workhorses of the PolicyCenter rating engine. They calculate various properties on costs, such as coverages and taxes, and can also set up rating information for subsequent routines. By defining these routines, you create reusable logic that simplifies complex calculations, ensuring consistency and accuracy across all policy ratings.

slides.notes: Guidelines for effective rating management in PolicyCenter.
slides.narration: Adhering to best practices in rating management helps ensure consistency and accuracy in PolicyCenter. By following these practices, you can optimize your rating processes and enhance the overall reliability of your PolicyCenter implementation.
